name: Exeter City FC History Trivia Game | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what year was the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1904.

	Exeter also moved into St James Park in 2003.

questions.text: Who was the club's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Arthur Chadwick.

	Chadwick was manager between 1908-22, followed by Maven (1923-27), Wilson (1928-29), and McDevitt had a spell between 1929-35.

The Grecians.

	Exeter City gained this nickname because of their co-founders, the Parish of St. Sidwell's. Their nickname was 'The Grecians' or 'The Greeks', so they applied it to the club.

questions.text: Which of these played the most League games for the club?
questions.explanation:
Arnold Mitchell.

	Mitchell played 495 League games for the club between 1952-66.

questions.text: Where did Exeter sign Don Goodman from in 2002?
questions.explanation:
Walsall.

	Goodman began his career with Castilla in 1983, before moving on to a host of clubs, including Bradford City, West Bromwich Albion, and Wolves.

questions.text: In which season, were Exeter first elected into the Football League?
questions.explanation:
1920-21.

	Exeter finished 19th out of 22 in Division Three this season, with 35 points from 42 games.

questions.text: Exeter set a secord for their biggest League victory in the 1926-27 season. Which team did they beat 8-1?
questions.explanation:
Coventry City.

	The game took place on 4th December, 1926, in the 1926-27 Division Three (South) season.

questions.text: Exeter won their first Football League Divisional title in the 1989-90 season, with 89 points. Which team finished second?
questions.explanation:
Grimsby Town.

	Exeter won the Division Four title by 10 points, with Grimsby second on 79, Southend 3rd with 75, and Maidstone fourth on 73 points.

questions.text: Who in 1928, became Exeter's youngest ever player?
questions.explanation:
Cliff Bastin.

	Bastin played against Coventry City on 14th April, 1928, at the age of 16 years and 41 days. The game finished a 0-0 draw.

questions.text: Which of these was capped for the Republic of Ireland, while playing for Exeter?
questions.explanation:
Dermot Curtis.

	Curtis gained one cap for Ireland while at Exeter, and scored 23 goals in 91 games for the club.
